   • Project an intriguing image or a single evocative word on the screen.  
   • Give everyone 2–3 minutes to jot down a mini “scene” inspired by it.  
   • Pair up and swap stories—partners read each other’s pieces and offer one upbeat comment.  
   • Accessibility tweaks: pairs can write feedback on sticky notes or paper, so no one needs to speak if they prefer written sharing.

3. Character-Ball Bounce  
   • Everyone writes three quirky character traits (e.g., “loves midnight baking,” “speaks in rhymes”) on a sheet, then crumples it into a “character ball.”  
   • Stand or stay seated in a loose circle and gently toss balls around for 1–2 minutes.  
   • Catch a ball, open it, invent a backstory on paper in 2 minutes, then read that snippet aloud.  
   • Accessibility tweaks: seated version for mobility; readers can pass the paper to a volunteer to read aloud if they’d rather not speak.

Which idea jumps out at you as the favorite? Let me know, and we can dive deeper—or feel free to share any extra details or twists you’d like!
